title: Formally known as Deer park now renamed as zoo
review: This is very old attraction on dehradun know as dear park but recently changed to dehradun zoo.

title: Dehradun zoo
review: Hi

title: Fantastic  place
review: It is the only place in dehradun where you can find fun, thrill and solitude. A very good place for the children to explore the wild life and zoo .

title: Nice one
review: Very beautiful park, formerly known as Malsi Deer Park , nice place to hang on , having aquarium ,which is very good , You can see here Leopard, alligator,birds and deer also. A 3D movie theater,  and a restaurent also .

title: Malsi deer park
review: for the first time in my life i was very disappointed after visiting this place. all the animals seemed dozed off as if they all were being drugged, the place is very small , even the leopard didn't get up. the only plus point this place has is their bird collection, though not huge but moderate.

title: very nice zoo
review: Surprisingly well designed and fun zoo.

title: Regularly Developing
review: Here you can see different kind of birds, crocodiles,deers,Leopard, fishes, 3d movies, fox flying etc. They are regularly improving as recently they have started color flowered cactus nursery from where u can purchase them, swings for children. Paisa vasool

title: Attraction of Dehradun
review: Zoo of dehradun has recently been an attraction for tourists coming to Dehradun. Previously it was known as dear park but ñow it has so many animals which is worth seeing for childrens.  It is situated on main. Mussoorie road .

title: Dehradun zoo visit with family
review: I would suggest each and every Traveller or tourist who passes dehradun for further places like mussoorie or dhanaulti to take a 1-2 hour hault at Dehradun Zoo. And if you are staying in Dehradun then you can surely take out some time for it. Trust the zoo won't be just another zoo, you might feel landing up in some another planent as it has been built with very efficient, effective and creative thought. The zoo is under top 10 zoo' of the world. Go for it.

title: Close to nature
review: This place is situated in foothills of Mussoorie hill station and it is very calm and peaceful and have a forest cover all around and few animals as well . U can enjoy the time with friends or your partner and can have your talks in the peace and feel good

title: Visit
review: Last year in my summer vacation I want Dehradun for a trip.Dehradun is capital of UUtrakhand. It's a lovely tourist place to visit.I visited ghanta Ghar which is the main market place of Dehradun .And also see deers in malsi deer Park.This deer Park is a small Corbet park in this park I also see Monkees and other Bird

title: Jordar jagah
review: Actually I was about to skip this place way back from masoori  I spotted this on the way. Thank god it was very  worthy visit. Do not Miss this place both  bird zoo. Fish aquarium and roap way also soon one cactus garden is also comming.

title: Decent experience for a Zoo
review: We visited the place in jan'18 while coming back from Mussoorie (to Delhi). The place was decent. The parking spaces available was less than the footfall. So I would suggest you to visit the place in morning time. The zoo area was big with good options of washrooms at places. It has good variety if birds but lacked the same for other animals. Lots of cages were empty and were also under construction so I am assuming they have plans of bringing in more animals. The aquatic life was very good. They had some beautiful collection of aquatic life. They had a separate ticket for that. The canteen in the zoo was very basic. I could not see hygiene being their first priority and also very few items available. I suggest you to bring your food there. The canteen is almost at the end (before the exit). I am sure in coming years this place would get a  lot better.

title: Nice big zoo..
review: 3d movie is gr8

title: Very Good place to visit
review: Very good place to visit In Dehradun

title: Not worth a visit
review: The place closes at 5pm.  So, we reached it in a hurry.  It was all over in 30 minutes.  If you don't have much time, you can conveniently skip it.  The problem is that, there aren't many places in Dehradun, so we had no choice but to visit it.

title: A good picnic spot
review: I liked this place for its location. It’s at one end of a Reserve Forest. The Zoo has limited species of a few birds. At another end is a large enclosure with a number of deers. The sight of the deers moving in a herd, a lone deer fawn looking curiously at the visitors, a buck exhibiting his supremacy by leading from the front & another buck on the watch at the rear end, were pleasing sights.

title: Pass Time
review: We spotted this zoo on our way to  from Dehradun to Mussoorie, at about 10 kilometers distance, This is a beautiful small zoological park.  There are many deer, some Tiger, Peacock, Rabbits and Neelgaay.  An average  sight-seeing cum picnic spot. Many food stalls are just outside the zoo.

title: Not much animals in there
review: THe vsit to this zoo was disappointing. The entry fee is Rs 20 per adult and 10 for kids. But there is not much animals there compared to other zoos. Also as the terrain is hilly it will be difficult for old persons. There is an aquarium inside but you have to pay additional 50 entry fee there

title: Its average zoo
review: Dehradun zoo is very average zoo .Actually previously it was known as malasi deer park later in 2017 it was converted into zoo . Though it is situated in foot of Missouri hill so it is surrounded by beautiful scenic view but u ll not find various kind of animals inside the zoo.

title: Only birds and aquatic
review: Small zoo. Located right on highway around 25 km from mussoorie. Parking is abundant charges 40 rs. Entry fee is 20 rs per adult and 10 rs per child. At present it was under construction. The zoo houses mainly birds. Rest few deer, one leopard, 2 crocodiles. But monkeys are abundant freely roaming. If u have nothing else to do and very bored, only then u go. Otherwise can be skipped.

title: One time visit
review: It is on way to Mussorie by the side of main road.

title: Well maintained
review: Very clean and well managed Zoo. Though there are not much animals, Everything is well maintained. You can spend quality time with your kids there. There is very well maintained acquirium within the zoo which is another attraction within the zoo.

title: A nice place to be with the kids!!
review: Clean and well maintained, the zoo does not have too many wild animals but has a good collection of birds and fish. The separately built aquarium is worth visiting. Clean pathways and greenery around gives a nice feeling to the place.

title: A good place to spend an afternoon.
review: Not very big. It is re-modifying at the time we traveled. good collection of birds. some other animals are also there. children will enjoy the tour. Oh. an aquarium with several fishes and water animals are also there.

title: Renovated zoo
review: The zoo has been recently renovated. There is only one leopard and no other big cats.the newest aquarium is very good and well maintained. The enterance   fee is only Rs.20 for the zoo and 50 for the aquarium

title: mini zoo ... well maintained
review: this zoo can be termed as mini zoo and only one leopard other than birds is there. the brand aquarium is worth visiting.the birds are under sponsored upkeep. the over all zoo is maintained very clean and neat

title: Well maintained Zoo
review: Zoo is in between Dehradun to Mussoorie. On our way back from Mussoorie to Dehradun, since we had some time before our train, we went to Dehradun Zoo to spend some time. Zoo was neatly maintained. Entry fee was nominal. It was not crowded. There were not too many animals or birds. Aquarium had separate entry fee so we didnt go to the aquarium that was there inside the zoo.

title: Fun place
review: A place in nature. You can spend time here with a peace of mind along with families. Kids will really appreciate and enjoy here. Nicely maintained but collection of animals are low. This can be developed one of the best maintained.

title: Small Zoo
review: A very small zoo. One hour enough. Small kids may enjoy better. Can see leopard from very close.

title: Decent Park
review: It's a small deer park currently being transformed into a Zoo. Only one big cat on the entry. Those who love birds especially parrots will find the place very fascinating. Worth visiting once.

title: Variety of animals to see
review: The place has a variety of animals to see. Apart from the number of deers, it houses a vast variety of birds. Good place to be for the nature lovers.

title: Malsi deer park
review: Having been to many places that have similar attractions, this was a disappointment. Few animals, few birds....

title: Good for kids
review: It is on way to Mussorie by the side of main road. Now it is called Dehradun Zoo.

title: a casual place
review: Went with  friends after bunking second half of college. I believe the company of friends was more interesting than the place. they kept two to three animals also in cage. It's a vast park to take a walk

title: Beautiful
review: Now known as the Dehradun Zoo.  Under some construction with significant upgrades in progress.  It is new but there are many types of animals & birds there is also a park cum garden. Allover amazing............

title: A Zoo in thew middle of the city
review: The extension work is just going on. The birds section is attractive and is having variety of birds. Animal section is only having very few of them. Many fenced areas are empty so may be they are in the process making it up.

title: Beautiful Zoo
review: I am Tushar Kamboj and my best friend Sneha unital went to dehradun zoo..the zoo is very beautiful and amazing ...its a large canteen in zoo

title: Avoidable
review: If you are not into trees and natural beauty, no point of coming here. You wont find any deers here, thats for sure

title: Stay away, unless you have nothing else to do
review: Same thing happened to me.I stay in Dehradun and this zoo is 2 km from my place. During one boring weekend, I planned to visit the zoo. Entry fee is 20 bucks which you pay to see few turkey, crocs, emu, few other birds and a leopard. Biggest letdown is the aquarium. One must avoid that. You have to pay 50 bucks for nothing. All the fish they display are there in my 3 feet home aquarium except for one cute stingray. Stay away. Still if you are real desperate to visit the zoo, take a bus to musoorie or a rik or ola cab. It is 2 km from mussorie diversion, kishanpur off rajpur road.

title: Dehradun city of joy
review: Dehradun is a valley situated at shivalik ranges it have many places to visit which are near to it like rajpur road market, ghuchu pani which is fabulous waterfall, shahstra dhara a picnic spot where there is a hot water coming from inside the Earth. It's near to mussoorie. Where locals enjoy many road trips. Rajpur road is a nice place to visit for shopping and eating joints. Dehradun zoo is at mussoorie road known as malsi dear park.  Near to pestle weed college.

title: Fun and frolic and peek at wild animals
review: Enjoyed the visit to the park along with office staff and their families. The kids enjoyed the visit in particular.

title: Good Place for Kids and Family
review: This used to be a small wild life park with not much facilities. But since government has declared it to be a proper Zoo and provided funds, there is continuous improvement. We went with our grand son and he thouroughly enjoyed the place.

title: Still to upgrade
review: It will take time for upgradation of the Dehradun zoo / mansi deer park...You can find numerous deers of different types. Leapod only 1, aviary is too small, three crocs, different birds...

title: A halt - On way to Mussorie
review: It is on the way to Mussorie. As we were passing by this place, our driver told its a nice zoo. So we took a halt and went inside, but it was not so great. Different kinds of deer can be seen here, and nothing much. It is closed on Monday.

title: One time visit but need infra push..
review: We heard from locals that Mansi Deer Park is great place to visit especially for kids so visited the place. Its on Mussorrie road and now the name has changed to Zoo.

title: beautiful
review: beautiful surroundings, lovely area, awesome veiw of the mussorrie hills. have some beautiful child hood memories.

title: Good to visit
review: If you have enough time, you can actually visit this place. Good place to spend an hour or two. Check the closing time before you go. They start closing it from 5:30PM.

title: Best Deer Park
review: This deer park is one of the best in India and is very helpful in developing tourism in Dehradun district

title: Small zoo
review: Children will enjoy, but it is not very big in comparison with Delhi Zoo or Bangalore Zoo. There is a variety of Deer, aviary etc.

title: Old forest work
review: Not very good maintenance so if planning be carefull..very less deers.. wont even look like a forest..

title: Good can Be added to list only if having Extra Time
review: This is on the foothill of mussoorie highway. Good for nature lovers. It is being converted into a Zoo thats why lots of construction work is underway. So nothing great about this, but somebody has extra time and want some place to spend time in a noise free area, then it can be visited. Or it can be covered while going to mussoorie or during return journey as it is on the way.

title: Stupidest Zoo
review: Literally  has no animals it is an insult to call it a deer park or a zoo as it had no deers Hope no one even tries to go here

title: The Deer Park!!
review: A one time visit for those who love animals especially deers. A few kms from rajpur road..you can take an auto and reach here within 20 minutes. You can see a lot of Deers and few rare birds like ostrich, emu, etc.. The place isnt very expensive and is a one time visit!!!

title: Popular among all ages..
review: Malsi Deer Park is situated in Mussoorie Diversion Road, Dehradun.It's been one of the most classy locations in Dehradun. My family accompanied me to this place 2 months back and we experienced an awesome trip altogether.The atmosphere is calm and peaceful out there while the nature contains it's unique beauty.

title: kids fun
review: Deer park of dehradun is a small park where deer habitat..good to spent evening with kids..here I enjoyed a family gathering with kids

title: Nice place
review: Lot of variety of birds here, you get a good information.

title: Must visit
review: It's new version too good...children enjoyed a lot . Flying fox  is the main attraction for the kids....Full day masti..............

title: Still in the making
review: The zoo is yet to be completed it seems. But the few enclosures that it has are good. We liked the owls the best.

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: This place is changing lots day by day and getting maintaince and upgradtion too. Kids loves to spot birds and animals.lovely place to have family outing or with friends.

title: Zoo/Park
review: Its a zoo cum park. A lot of people visit this place, especially with young children. Not a lot of animals in 2015, but it is currently under renovation. Hopefully will get better.

title: A nice place with healthy mix of animals. Amenities have an immense scope of improvement.
review: This place has a healthy mix of animals - quite a few deer and various varieties of birds along with a leopard. A portion of the park is, however, locked out and a few enclosures are being built to accommodate additional animals.

title: Quite a place for Kids & family for an outing
review: Almost a mini zoo for kids to watch and adore wild animals. Ample space to roam around, the variety of birds is good to watch and kids can have fun with swings & play area around.

title: Hopeless Park
review: There is nothing in the park other than green trees. You can find a few varieties of birds cages in the ark and a handful of deers in the Deer park. There is no adventure no fun. Just a waste of time

title: Scope for improvement
review: The park is located on the Mussoorie Dehradun road. The park has very less animals and the amenities also are lacking. There is scope for improvement.

title: Nice place on way to Mussoorie!
review: Malsi Deer Park on Mussoorie Road, is generally a must-visit for all non-doonites on way to or from Mussoorie. This deer park has recently been upgraded in its classification as upcoming "Dehradun Zoo".

title: Only zoo in town
review: It was only a deer park to begin with. Later on few parakeets were added. As of September 2016 this is under renovation and expansion.

title: Lovely place to relax
review: Have been there many a times during last 30 years or so. Always found it peaceful, relaxing and very close to the nature.

title: Nothing much to see
review: We visited the Malsi Deer Park in the month of Aug 2016. There were a few birds, deers and a leopard. Apart from this there is nothing much for adults to see/do. Also they charged an entry fee of rs.20 per person and rs. 50 for car parking.

title: Only for families with little kids
review: Anyone exploring Dehradun and Mussoorie will find this place as a tourist destination.  However this will be fun only if you are on a family trip with kids below 12 years.  Watching many Deer and a leopard cramped in different areas with monkeys sprinkled around the trees is all you have.  Minor kid games and of course greenery.

title: An small zoo
review: This is an small zoo . If kids are there in you group then you should go there . There are some deer a, a leopard and some birds , not too much but worth visiting and it will take 1-2 hours.

title: Average type of park
review: The park is located on Massorie road, large and lots of animals there but the situation of animals are so pathetic specially tiger are in very small cage and so much disturbed by the crowd. Management must improve the situations of animals and give them a better living area.

title: Place for Picnic
review: Zoo with good amount of animal and fun place to spend few hours with kids. Zoo run by government. It one good place to visit.

title: Average - not well maintained
review: There is nothing special about this place. Just a normal place that you can find in any other city. So, go there only if you have nothing else to do.

title: Nature and caged animals
review: If you want a time with nature visit this place, its always filled with visitors , also the malsi bridge is considered as haunted, beware because the road turns are dangerous and have caused too many accidents

title: A Delight for Kids
review: We took our daughter here and she had an amazing time! I recommend everyone should see this deer park, especially if you have kids in tow. There is a variety of birds here, and deers, of course. But the highlight of our visit were the tigers who were very active and were roaring when we went. I am not a fan of keeping animals in cages, but this was a different experience. The children's park has loads of swings.

title: Good for kids
review: nice little play area for kids.. lots of swings and you can see deer, leopard and birds too. Good place to spend few hours with kids

title: Upcoming Park
review: A Park cum wild-life area, is still under renovation. More enclosures are being constructed, few wild-life current housed. The Leopards are an attraction.

title: Not worth visiting
review: Same as deer park in Delhi. Can be skipped without any second thought. Please do not include in your itinerary.

title: Nice place for families to sit and have lunch!
review: This is basically a park similar to the Ines found in Delhi and other parts of up etc. There is nothing unique part from you can see some ostrich here. It is also going through construction (it is being converted into a zoo).

title: Popular picnic haunt of dooniites!
review: In terms of activities or sightseeing there the deer park has nothing much to offer. I remember being a regular visitor as a child and enjoyed the swings inside the park but the place lost its charm as we grew up. The route towards the deer park is good though and you can enjoy a cup of tea with friends right outside the park! It is amidst the green belt so a walk within the park is a good option.

title: Play with Kids
review: If you are heading to Massourie, then this place is on the way. Its closed on Mondays and visit this place if you are not in a hurry, You can moved around, play or just relax

title: park nested on the hills
review: beautiful park nested in hills on the way to mussourie. u can find some deer. enjoy tea under the tall trees in the park

title: must visit place if you are animal lover
review: its really an awesome experience to watch various breeds of owls and deers and most importantly find real life time experience to see a leopard there so closely..

title: Victim of Misfortune
review: It is a good park having a large area. At present its situation is very bad due to lack of upkeep. The sign of tear and wear are every where demanding a proper care from Authorities. It has a few Deer, a leopard,  some owls, eagles, cock and a few other birds.

title: Average place
review: Just like many other parks, not very maintained deer park. has a small play area for kids. can avoid if have other things to do.

title: Good - Visit if you have ample time to spare
review: Good but not a must see place, if you are running with tight schedule as you find Zoo/Deer park at many places...nothing unique here but ambience is good here. May require about a hours time to spare here.

title: A quick picnic
review: It is very close to Mussoorie diversion and is very vast in area. Super for kids as they can see a variety of animals and have a small play area. Pack your food and spend the entire day there and try to leave before sunset.

title: day picnic
review: If you have time and nowhere to go, then visit this place. Reasonably clean but crowded sit in the sun in winters and enjoy your food.

title: Good place for small outing in Dun with Kids
review: This is a Government Zoo cum park on the outskirts of Dehradun.

title: A weekend outing for kids
review: If you stay in dehradun its a place ur kids would insist on going. Its not a tourist destination buta small park with handful of animals. My son who is 3 yr old is fan of this place. Monkeys are enough for him to come to this place again and again.

title: Great for spending a morning with the kids
review: I used t live in Doon and one of the easiest 'time-pass' activities was to visit Malsi Deer Park - located in the city! On the turn off to Mussoorie Road.

title: Good place for wildlife lover
review: Malsi deer park spread in big area,artificial lake and various wild animals can be seen easily,different species of deer,its a good place.

title: Poor Infrastructure, poorly maintained, poor animals.
review: It's situated 8km from the city centre / Clock Tower and is a nice time pass destination especially if you have young kids.  Being Government owned and run you can expect the facilities to be sub standard.

title: wonderful
review: excellent place to visit with friends and family. Nice cool and relaxing place. Food not that great though.

title: So sad to see animals alone in cement jails
review: The deer seemed happy enough, but the place was in disrepair and most species were alone in a small cement floored cage and isolated. Not that many animals to see and not an educational visit about the species of India. Was a depressing experience, the animals were miserable.

title: good
review: its a good place for kids to enjoy and roam. but no food items are sold inside the garden. during day time the environment wasnt good as a lot of collage couple were there and with family it was embarrassing.

title: Only Children will enjoy
review: Last time I went to Malsi deer park was when I was a teenager. Not much has changed since then. Chidren will definitely enjoy the sight of herds of deer, the chirping birds and the hilly landscape. But the park is belw par when it come to facilities like a good canteen, proper washrooms etc. Despite being touted as a major tourist attraction in Dehradun the upkeep of the park is not up to mark. But if you have children with you on your trip here, the park is worth a look. Enjoy....

title: Animal enclosure for kids
review: Nothing much to do or see here. Entry fee is dirt cheap. This is located far out from the Dehradun town area,on the Mussoorie highway,just on the right hand side,before a culvert.

title: Poor Place
review: The name is deer park but there are no deer in this park only some owl and parrot. Be aware of monkey,the can take your belongings without your notice .Avoidable.

title: Good place for shot trip..
review: Its a quite place with not large crowd. There is a play area as well with swings for kids. Some animals & birds are also in the park.

title: not paid attention too
review: it is situated almost  8km from the Clock Tower.The entry is very cheap, its a very small park, with few animals, not maintained properly

title: Mini Zoo in Dehradun
review: It is actually a MINI ZOO, which inhibits the species of birds and animals fond in Dehradun Jungle.

title: Skippable. The leopard is the best attraction
review: Out of the way (by Dehradun standards). It houses some deer, a stunning leopard and some birds which you can't help but feeling sorry for (especially a gorgeous eagle).

title: Picnic Spot
review: When you travel from Dehradun to Mussoorie, you will find at about 10 kilometers distance, this  beautiful small zoological park.

title: Place for the children
review: If you like a place with plenty of trees and a few animals - this is ideal for very young children. Not much else there otherwise.

title: One time Show
review: It is a good place to visit with kids, but more often you will find the park occupied by couples. there are not many wild animals, few dears, a peacock, some rabbits, and a leopard. Still a rain checking visit can be made on a dull afternoon. Either a couple or a group visit is suggested.

title: U can miss it ...not worth.
review: This place doesn't fall near to its name... Deers are there but it's all unplanned ... Go only if u have nothing else to see...

title: Hope for improvement
review: Beautiful place, but not maintained lack of maintenance, broken rides ,  There are many deer. Apart from deer you can also see Injured leopard  , Peacock, Rabbits and few birds, & Dry man made lake, as government declared a Zoo, Hope for better developments.

title: Its good place for spending few time only.
review: As it is situated on the way of Mussorie and in Dehradun its all around nature spread therefore in spare time we can go there. Its a park only

title: Not as good as before....
review: Earlier, it was a fantastic place full of animals... but now, it is as good as an area for landfilling.

title: Malsi Deer Park
review: On the road from Dehradun to Mussourie at Rajpur. We saw a few spotted deer in the park, besides a spotted leopard and some birds. Of the birds, the owls were the most impressive.

title: Exciting as ever...
review: I vividly remember coming here as a kid for school picnics, it used to be a lot of fun and I've got to admit it was no less this time too!!!

title: worth visiting on the way
review: malsi dear park is a worth visit while heading towards mussoorie or while coming back ...While going to mussoorie i visited this place..after a rajpur road turn towards mussoorie, this parks comes in the right side ... my kid liked it a lot..watching deer everywhere is joyous..nice place..by paying a very minimal charge anyone can visit this park....much more thing is doable in this park..authority need t maintain it bit more, then definitely it would be a great attraction.

title: Underutilised Zoo
review: The children would have loved it if there is good collection of animals and other birds but unfortunately there is hardly anything to see inthis and we returned back in a very short time from this deer park.

title: Wonderful park !!
review: So many memories at the Malsi Deer Park. Very beautiful park, nice eating area as well. Kids love the park and there is so much for everyone to do and enjoy.

title: very poor condition
review: the poor animals and birds need to be let off rather than be kept this way very dirty, eagle in a tiny cage, too much too walk around in and in the heat people just end up playing in the grounds, no eating space and ambience is not great

title: Decent Place For Kids
review: It's a decent place for kids. Park has got few caged wildlife. There is a play area as well with swings for kids.

title: Just a deer park.
review: situated on massorrie road this park is just a deer park with a variety of deers of uttrakhand, they also have few birds and a dying tiger..

title: Something for kidz only
review: If you do not mind not seeing much in this park, then pls visit. But of you are expecting to see a big number of free running deer, it's exactly the wrong place for that. Good for small kidz who can just run around and play with monkeys and enjoy some swings and see saw rides. Beware of monkeys!

title: Time pass place
review: If u have a little time while going to mussorie do visit this place with your young ones, there are not so much of varieties but for a small break you can visit this place does have a parking lot not so much expensive just under Rs 100 you will get parking and tickets for entry in this small deer park.

title: Park to keep busy in nature
review: Just go by the name - Malsi dear park - I mean you can for sure see dears in the park in one corner.

title: morning walk
review: very few animals and birds.but the trek around is what it is worth for. It was distressing to see people irritating the animals with sticks and shouting around so that they come out of the resting places.

title: An apology for a zoo or wild life park
review: Just out of the Dehradun town on way to Mussorie, with an entry ticket, an ill maintained wildlife park with very few animals and a few lazy deer, aggressive monkeys poor facilities, easily a skip.

title: not a family picnic place
review: yes, there are animals to see and swings to be played, but the rampant caused by the monkeys is a huge put off. these monkeys will jump on you, snatch your food and might also hurt you or your kids. the other major setback about this place is the huge number of couples hiding behind the bushes or trees. its inappropriate and wierd to see when you are accompanied by your family.

title: Worth a visit - one time!
review: This park comes on the way to Mussoorie from Dehradun.The area of the park is decent! A variety if deer can be seen at this park; however nothing more than that. There is a small play area as well in the park.

title: Leopards and owls.
review: The place is good for those who're looking for a small wildlife retreat. There's an assortment of animals to be seen. The main attractions are the two leopards kept here. The park is well maintained.

title: Kids Like it
review: Good location,plenty of deers but be careful with lots of monkeys around.Nothing changed in this park ,it has potential to become best Dehradun attraction if authorities invest on it.

title: good place for kids
review: its natural with ample place. good place for children to be taken on holidays. children get to see and learn so much when they see with their own eyes,deer, ducks,rabbits,owls,peacocks and ofcourse cheeta fills them with curiosity and excitement.

title: Deer Park on the foothills of Mussorie
review: On the way to Mussoorie one can stop over at this deer park which is close to Rajpur Road in Dehradun and is easily approachable from Dehradun on way to Mussorie. The place has certain species of deer and the place is well maintained around the Mountain range, one can spend some time while in Dehradun or Mussoorie.

title: excellent for family with small children
review: small zoo type park with birds,rabbits and ofcourse deers
